item.title: SSH with a Bastion Host
item.description: A bastion host is a server that sits on a public network whose sole purpose is to provide access to an inner private network. For example, if you use AWS and have instances on a private VPC subnet, then the only way you can gain SSH access to them is to use a bastion host as a kind of proxy. You > Bastion > Server For the best security, you typically have SSH configured for key-only authentication.
